properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southwesterly winds will stir up the snow and reduce visibilities to near zero tonight. Conditions are expected to improve on Sunday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect this morning. Lake effect flurries off of Georgian Bay will continue this morning. Local snowfall accumulations up to 5 cm are possible by noon. Travel is expected to be difficult at times due to poor visibility in snow and local blowing snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads and walkways may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T01:43:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T09:44:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4286706271.2021
Area: Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls continue this morning. An intense snow squall band extending from Kincardine southeast to Ethel is currently affecting the area. This snow squall band will shift south and weaken throughout the morning. Local snowfall amounts up to 15 cm are possible under this band. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T22:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T13:29:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3963006769.2021
Area: Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect through early this afternoon. Heavy flurries off of Lake Huron continue. Snowfall rates of a few centimetres per hour and significantly reduced visibilities have been observed with these flurries. Additional snowfall accumulations may reach 5 cm locally by the time the snow tapers to flurries this afternoon. Motorists are advised to exercise caution as snow will make travel difficult in some areas. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T02:54:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T16:43:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2389518751.2021
Area: Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect through early this afternoon. Lake effect flurries off of Georgian Bay will diminish later this afternoon. Additional snowfall accumulations may reach 5 cm locally in the Collingwood and Stayner areas. Travel is expected to be difficult at times due to poor visibility in snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads and walkways may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T02:39:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T15:43:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3594380103.2021

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions are forecast to end early this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T05:17:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T20:27:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1999764251.2021

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southwesterly winds gusting near 90 kilometres per hour are expected beginning this evening. Winds should diminish during the day on Sunday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T12:24:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T20:25:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3861792156.2021
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extremely cold wind chills near minus 55 continue this morning. Wind chill values are expected to be in the minus 45 to minus 50 range by Saturday evening. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T06:03:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T15:22:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1606729831.2021
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Heavy snow and blowing snow today and tonight for White Pass to Fraser Camp as a frontal system pushes onshore across the South Klondike Highway. A total of 20 to 30 cm will fall near White Pass by Sunday morning. Strong southwest winds will today will give reduced visibility in blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T10:20:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T18:21:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2664490880.2021
Area: South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Heavy rain begins tonight as a frontal system bearing subtropical moisture pushes onto the B.C. coast. 50 to 80 mm of rain will fall. Stewart and Kitimat will see upwards of 50 mm of rain tonight. Bella Coola will see rain tonight but the heaviest rain will arrive on Sunday and continue Sunday night. Up to 80 mm will fall by Sunday night. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T10:43:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T18:44:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0446014684.2021
Area: Central Coast - inland sections, North Coast - inland including Kitimat, North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. An approaching frontal system will move onto the north and central coast this afternoon. Rain will begin this morning, become heavy at times tonight and then gradually ease on Sunday. Rainfall amounts of 100 to 150 mm are expected by Sunday evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T04:31:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T12:32:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0287024324.2021
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A frontal system approaching the BC coast will move across the BC Interior later today spreading snow the Williston region and the Pine Pass beginning this afternoon. Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm are possible in Williston region before the snow changes to rain on Sunday morning. The precipitation will remain as snow over the Pine Pass until late Sunday afternoon with total snowfall accumulations of 20 to 30 cm expected. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T04:39:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T12:40:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1892970887.2021
Area: Highway 97 - Pine Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Accumulating snow today. Total snowfall: up to 10 cm. Locations: eastern regions of Nova Scotia, including the Halifax area. Time span: continuing until this afternoon or evening. Remarks: Snow will end from west to east through the course of the day. Total accumulations are expected to be near 10 cm, with locally up to 15 cm possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T23:59:27-00:00

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning. Heavy flurries off of Lake Huron are occurring this morning. Additional local snowfall accumulations of up to 5 cm and reduced visibility are likely this morning. Locally heavy flurries may persist into the afternoon for southern Huron and Perth Counties. Motorists are advised to exercise caution as snow will make travel difficult in some areas. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
